text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Residential Tenancies (Amendment) Act 

2021 (Section 7) (Commencement) Order 2022.

title: of the Residential Tenancies (Amendment) Act 2021 (No. 39 of 2021) shall
heading: 2. The 4th day of April 2022 is appointed to be the day on which section 7
text_raw:
2. The 4th day of April 2022 is appointed to be the day on which section 7 
of the Residential Tenancies (Amendment) Act 2021 (No. 39 of 2021) shall 
come into operation. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

31 March, 2022. 

DARRAGH O’BRIEN, 

Minister for Housing, Local Government and Heritage. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 5th April, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [165] 3

title: of the Residential Tenancies (Amendment) Act 2021 (No. 39 of 2021) shall
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This Order appoints 4 April 2022 as the date on which section 7 of the 
Residential Tenancies (Amendment) Act 2021 (No. 39 of 2021) shall come 
into operation. 

Section 7 amends section 134 (Obligation to apply to register tenancy) of the 
Residential Tenancies Acts 2004 to 2021 to provide that, subject to the 
condition outlined below, where a landlord applies to register a ‘further Part 4 
tenancy’ before the commencement date (4 April 2022) for the requirement to 
register tenancies on an annual basis under sections 22 and 23 of the 
Residential Tenancies (Amendment) Act 2019 and that tenancy still exists on 4 
April 2022, no annual registration fee shall apply in respect of that ‘further Part 
4 tenancy’ for so long as it exists (i.e. until it is terminated by the tenant or 
landlord or until the expiry of its 6 year term). 

A condition applies to the temporary waiver from the annual registration fee, 
insofar as any outstanding registration fee associated with the relevant 
application to register a ‘further Part 4 tenancy’ prior to 4 April 2022 must be 
paid not later than 1 month (i.e. by 4 May 2022) of the commencement of the 
requirement to register tenancies annually. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [165]
